review: OMG...  This this is awful.  There is an old saying that "You get what you pay for."  This is a perfect example.  You'll be better off buying a device that connects wireless from you computer to your tv.  They cost around 100 bucks.  I had one that failed after a 1 1/2 so I tried one of these, thinking anything from the guys at Google cannot be all that bad.  Boy was I wrong.  All the software was labeled "beta".  They should be paying be to be a beta tester instead of me paying to be a guinea pig.  It did everything that was advertised, but badly.  Keep away until all the bugs have been worked out.  I'm sorry I cannot put "0" stars.

review: The Chromecast is a nice little product, just about the cheapest way you can smarten up a dumb tv.  I'm an Apple guy, so I like the Apple TV better, but if you're on the Android/Google Play system, or don't want to spend a bit more money for the Apple TV, this is a pretty good substitute. I got a bunch of them and installed them on all my dumb tv's just so I could stream netflix and other media from my phone.  It would be great if the Chromecast had Amazon Prime, though.
